demo.content:
Medication: Ibuprofen
Class: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID)
Common uses: Pain relief; Reduce inflammation; Lower fever
Common side effects: Nausea, Heartburn, Dizziness
Important warnings: Risk of gastrointestinal bleeding; Possible cardiovascular risk
Interactions note: Caution with anticoagulants and other NSAIDs.
Educational information only. Not medical advice. Consult a licensed healthcare professional. Not for emergencies.
I cannot provide dosing, diagnostic, or emergency guidance. Educational information only. Not medical advice. Consult a licensed healthcare professional. Not for emergencies.

Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) commonly used for pain relief, reducing inflammation, and lowering fever. Common side effects include nausea, heartburn, and dizziness. Serious warnings associated with ibuprofen involve the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding and possible cardiovascular risks. It is important to use caution when taking ibuprofen with anticoagulants or other NSAIDs due to potential interactions. 

DISCLAIMER: This information is educational and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Always consult a healthcare provider for diagnosis and treatment.
Educational information only. Not medical advice. Consult a licensed healthcare professional. Not for emergencies.
I cannot provide dosing, diagnostic, or emergency guidance. Educational information only. Not medical advice. Consult a licensed healthcare professional. Not for emergencies.
